title: LinkedIn Jobs Scraper Input
description: Configure what to scrape from LinkedIn Jobs. Provide keywords, location, and optional filters.

keywords.sectionDescription: Define what jobs to search for. At least keywords or location is required.
keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: Job search keywords (e.g. 'python developer', 'data engineer', 'product manager').

location.title: Location
location.description: Location to search for jobs (e.g. 'United States', 'San Francisco, CA', 'Remote').

geoId.title: Geo ID (optional)
geoId.description: LinkedIn geographic ID for precise location filtering. Example: 103644278 for United States. Overrides text location if provided.

datePosted.sectionDescription: Narrow results by date, job type, experience level, and work arrangement.
datePosted.title: Date posted
datePosted.description: Filter jobs by when they were posted.

workType.title: Work arrangement
workType.description: Filter by on-site, remote, or hybrid.

fetchJobDetails.sectionDescription: Control output depth, limits, and proxy configuration.
fetchJobDetails.title: Fetch full job details
fetchJobDetails.description: For each job, load the full detail page to extract description, salary, seniority level, employment type, job function, and industries. This is slower and uses more proxy traffic but gives much richer data.

maxResults.title: Max results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of job listings to return. LinkedIn caps search results at 1,000 per query. Free users are limited to 25 per run.

proxyConfiguration.sectionDescription: LinkedIn may block datacenter IPs. Residential proxies are recommended for reliability.
proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Proxy settings. Residential proxies are recommended for reliable scraping.
